info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:49AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central McDowell, southeastern Mitchell and west central Burke Counties through 1215 PM EDT... At 1148 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Marion, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spruce Pine, Marion, Lake James State Park, Lake James, Linville Falls, B.R. Parkway-Little Switzerland To Linville, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland, Nebo, Ashford and Woodlawn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
